jobPosting.title: Vouched - FSE
jobPosting.content:
https://www.glassdoor.com/job-listing/full-stack-engineer-vouched-JV_KO0,19_KE20,27.htm

Vouched
Full Stack Engineer

At Vouched we are building a powerful identity verification platform to provide worldwide access to life’s most critical services, such as healthcare and prescription services, banking, and lending. Vouched makes identity verification easy with a combination of AI cloud solutions, machine learning, data checks, and APIs at the edge. Our customers leverage our APIs, integrations, and no-code solutions to onboard customers to their systems. At Vouched, your work provides businesses with frictionless and fair access to healthcare, financial services, and work opportunities.

What we do

Verify thousands of people every day across multiple countries and industries, providing access to critical services
Serve fast-growing startups, unicorns, and large enterprises with a focus on providing fast, easy integration for developers
Run on a modern cloud infrastructure powered by automated integration and testing, provisioning, deployments, monitoring, and notifications
Drive to own the market and deliver a world-changing client and end-user experience
We are a small but mighty team looking for people who align with our values and have a strong sense of hustle, creative problem-solving, grit, and energy to help us scale! This role at Vouched offers lots of growth potential!

What you will do

Work closely with our product team to deliver valuable enhancements incrementally.
Build features across stack with, but not limited to: Typescript, React, PostgreSQL, Redis, Node.js, Python, REST, Docker.
Build APIs and SDKs to access ML/DL models.
Define testable technical specifications with edge cases, security, and scalability in mind.
Build, test, tune and debug across the entire production stack.
Work in a Scrum engineering process environment.
Work in a customer-focused, lean engineering and evolving late-stage startup environment.
Requirements

BS/MS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or equivalent computational science degree.
2-5+ years experience with SaaS backend engineering, with Node.js, Typescript and/or Python, with a Github and Terraform-based CI/CD deployment system.
Technical lead capability, with a collaborative and mentoring mindset.
Experience building end-to-end capabilities.
Experience working with microservices.
Drive and ambition to be an owner.
Polyglot engineer mindset.
Deep expertise in backend with front-end skills and exposure, and a willingness to jump into unfamiliar areas.
Strong preference for candidates based in the Seattle, WA area.

jobPosting.title: GM SE Driverless
jobPosting.content:
https://generalmotors.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Careers_GM/job/Remote---United-States/Software-Engineer_JR-202511054
General Motors
Software Engineer

Job Description
DUTIES:

Develop and design software applications for driverless technology company. Duties may include: Perform software engineering duties to drive scalable dispatching services for our commercial ride-hailing and delivery businesses. This position works on two sides of dispatch; the first matches users with vehicles to serve their needs, and the other aims to optimize
vehicle utilization by directing them to various parts of the city to perform jobs such as collecting data, validating data, and serving anticipated demand. Projects include development of very accurate ETA models, efficient matching of rides/deliveries to the AV, automated managing of the fleet to send the AV to the hotspots or wherever the demand is higher to pick up the
passengers. Take ownership of quarterly dispatch projects, from design to implementation. Test and validate your code via unit, integration, end-to-end, and occasionally road tests with self-driving vehicles. Review code change requests of peers, and produce well-tested, descriptive code change requests for your code. Be responsible for sprint-level planning, delegating
tasks to peers, and collaborating with external stakeholders and dependencies. Create and maintain design documents, and conduct design reviews for your proposals. Monitor the health and performance of your services / features collecting relevant metrics and setting up appropriate alerts (tools are already available). May telecommute.


Additional Job Description
REQUIREMENTS:

Master's degree or foreign equivalent degree in Computer Science, or a related field; plus, 3 years of work experience as a Software Engineer, Software Development Engineer, System Development Engineer, or a related occupation. Background, education, or experience must include: Docker & Kubernetes; Postgres and database design; Postgis; Asynchronous messaging; Redis; Bash scripting; Typescript; Cloud technologies; and Linux.

Compensation:

The expected base compensation for this role is $186,900.00 to $205,000.00 Annually.
Actual base compensation within the identified range will vary based on factors relevant to the position.
Bonus Potential: An incentive pay program offers payouts based on company performance, job level, and individual performance.
#LI-DNI


About GM
Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.


Why Join Us
We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Every day, we want every employee to feel they belong to one General Motors team.


Benefits Overview
From day one, we're looking out for your well-being–at work and at home–so you can focus on realizing your ambitions. Learn how GM supports a rewarding career that rewards you personally by visiting Total Rewards Resources .

coverLetter.content:
Dear Hiring Manager,

I am applying for the Software Engineer position at GM's driverless technology division. With extensive experience developing scalable services and microservices architecture, I offer relevant skills that align with your dispatch system requirements.

As a member of a 5-person innovation team at Travelers, I contributed to developing complex distributed systems, including a cloud-native solution using TypeScript and Docker. Working within microservices architecture, I helped build reliable, scalable services while maintaining high performance standards. This experience directly relates to your dispatch system's needs for accurate ETA modeling and efficient ride matching.

My technical background includes hands-on experience with several technologies crucial to your stack, including TypeScript, Docker, PostgreSQL, and distributed systems. While I have not worked directly with Kubernetes, I bring strong related experience with AWS services, cloud technologies, and database design. I am currently expanding my skills through machine learning coursework, which would benefit your team's work on predictive dispatch algorithms and demand optimization.

What excites me most about this role is the opportunity to solve complex real-world challenges in autonomous vehicle technology. My experience monitoring service health, implementing comprehensive testing strategies, and participating in sprint-level planning aligns well with your team's needs. I have consistently demonstrated the ability to take ownership of projects from design through implementation, including creating detailed technical documentation and conducting thorough code reviews.

I look forward to discussing how my background in scalable service development and system optimization could contribute to GM's driverless technology initiatives.

Best regards,
Michael Paulukonis
coverLetter.sampleContent:
Hiring Manager
TRV InsuraMatch
Hartford, CT

**RE: Software Engineer II Position**

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Software Engineer II position at InsuraMatch. With over 5 years of experience at Travelers, I have developed extensive expertise in insurance technology solutions using the exact technology stack specified in your requirements - JavaScript, Python, and SQL, along with AWS services and Twilio integration.

As a member of a 5-person innovation team at Travelers, I contributed to developing a new insurance tech product that launched in under 6 months using Node.js, TypeScript, and Vue.js. I helped build a cloud-native phone solution using Twilio and AWS Lambda, demonstrating the practical application of serverless architecture for customer interactions. My experience with microservices architecture includes working with AWS services like API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDB, while maintaining high code quality standards through comprehensive testing practices.

I'm particularly excited about InsuraMatch's focus on generative AI platforms. As a contributor to a patent for AI-driven analysis systems (US11,132,565B2) and through my current pursuit of Python for Data Science and Machine Learning coursework, I bring both established expertise and emerging skills in this rapidly evolving space. This ongoing learning demonstrates my commitment to growing technical capabilities, especially in areas crucial to InsuraMatch's future.

What attracts me most to this role is the opportunity to transform InsuraMatch's technology landscape while solving complex insurance technology challenges. I've successfully delivered multiple insurance-specific solutions and would welcome the chance to bring this experience to your team. My background in establishing testing best practices and providing technical guidance to team members aligns well with your needs for quality-focused development and mentorship.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to discussing how my skills and experience align with your needs.

Sincerely,
Michael Paulukonis

jobPosting.title: A new job awaits
jobPosting.content:
LaunchDarkly is seeking an experienced Full Stack Engineer to join our Feature Management team. This team’s mission is to empower developers with best-in-class controls and insights for managing software features. LaunchDarkly is best known for its Feature Management product, and in this role you’ll be at the forefront of impacting developers in this highly visible area. You’ll build features and tooling that are critically embedded throughout the software development lifecycle. You’ll enable developers improve their efficiency with seamless control of their software releases.

Responsibilities

Design and implement developer-first tooling such as MCP servers and browser toolbars. 
Deeply understand developer workflows so that you can streamline developer experiences. Directly influence the developer roadmap and experiential details by representing the voice of the developer. 
Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, UX designers, and engineers to create cohesive, end-to-end developer experiences. 
Participate actively in architecture planning, code reviews, and mentoring peers in full-stack best practices. 
As part of our you-build-it-you-run-it culture, all developers may be responsible of support applications in production, including on-call. 

Qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience building full stack web applications. Familiarity with Typescript, React, Node, and Go is preferred but not required. 
Strong sense of ownership and accountability for delivering impactful solutions. 
Proven ability to work closely with Product and Design teams to define requirements for new features in a fast-paced iterative environment. 
You write code that can be easily understood by others, with an eye towards maintainability. 
You hold yourself and others to a high bar when working with production systems. 
You value high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices. 
Strong collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills; committed to continuous learning about emerging technologies and mobile best practices. 
Experience utilizing AI tooling to enhance daily engineering efficiency.

[Date]

Hiring Manager
LaunchDarkly
[Company Address]

**Subject: Application for Full Stack Engineer, Feature Management**

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am applying for the Full Stack Engineer position with LaunchDarkly's Feature Management team. With over 10 years of experience building developer tools and systems, I am drawn to your mission of creating best-in-class controls for managing software features.

At Travelers, I led development of a new insurance technology product, delivering it from concept to market in 8 months. Using Node.js, TypeScript, and Vue.js with AWS serverless architecture, I collaborated with product and design teams to define requirements and implement solutions. I established testing practices using Mocha, Chai, and Cypress, maintaining high code quality while meeting aggressive deadlines. This experience aligns with your team's emphasis on maintainable code and engineering excellence.

My background includes creating developer-focused tools that improve workflow efficiency. As technical lead for SkipScreen, a Firefox extension that automated common user tasks, I grew the user base to 500,000 daily active users. At Insurity, I led development of a forms configuration tool used by both internal and external developers, implementing automated testing and modernizing the architecture. While I've primarily used Vue.js recently, I have experience with React and consistently demonstrate quick proficiency with new technologies.

I currently use AI tools like GitHub Copilot to enhance my development workflow and am completing coursework in AI/ML to expand these capabilities. I am comfortable with on-call responsibilities and have experience supporting production systems through the full development lifecycle.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to discussing how my background in developer tooling and commitment to code quality could benefit the LaunchDarkly team.

Sincerely,
Michael Paulukonis

April 15, 2025

Hiring Manager
LaunchDarkly
San Francisco, CA

**RE: Full Stack Engineer - Feature Management Team**

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Full Stack Engineer position on LaunchDarkly's Feature Management team. Your mission to empower developers with best-in-class controls for managing software features aligns perfectly with my experience building developer tools and enterprise applications.

Throughout my career, I've focused on creating robust, maintainable systems that improve developer efficiency. At Travelers, I led the development of a microservices architecture that streamlined the development workflow for a 5-person innovation team. Using TypeScript and modern web technologies, we delivered a new insurance tech product from concept to market in under 6 months. This experience demonstrated my ability to build developer-first tooling while maintaining high standards for code quality and testing.

My background in full-stack development includes working with React, TypeScript, and various cloud services. I've implemented comprehensive testing strategies using tools like Mocha and Cypress, and I understand the critical importance of automated testing in maintaining reliable production systems. While collaborating with product managers and UX designers, I've consistently delivered solutions that balance technical excellence with user needs.

I'm particularly drawn to LaunchDarkly's "you-build-it-you-run-it" culture, as it matches my experience with on-call responsibilities and production support. I've established testing best practices for innovation projects and mentored peers in full-stack development, which I believe would be valuable in contributing to your team's success.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to discussing how my skills and experience align with LaunchDarkly's needs.

Sincerely,

Michael Paulukonis

That insurance tech project I mentioned at Travelers? We took it from a concept to a full-blown product in under 8 months. I was all over the full stack—Node.js, TypeScript, and Vue.js, all running on AWS serverless components. I also set up our testing pipeline with Mocha, Chai, and Cypress because shipping clean, maintainable code is non-negotiable, and it sounds like your team holds that same high bar.

My whole thing is streamlining workflows for users, like with my old Firefox extension, SkipScreen, which blew up to over 500,000 daily users. I know you all use React, and while my recent work is in Vue, they're two sides of the same coin. I'll get up to speed faster than Loki can cause some mischief. Talk soon,

Michael Paulukonis

Hiring Manager
LaunchDarkly

**Subject: Application for Full Stack Engineer, Feature Management**

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my strong interest in the Full Stack Engineer position with LaunchDarkly's Feature Management team. Your mission to build best-in-class controls that improve the software development lifecycle resonates with my professional experience, where I have focused on creating robust, developer-centric tools and systems.

At Travelers, I was part of a small team that built a new insurance technology product from concept to market in under 8 months. This required close collaboration with product and design teams to define requirements and iterate quickly. I designed and built the full-stack solution using Node.js, TypeScript, and Vue.js, supported by a serverless microservices architecture on AWS. To ensure system reliability and maintainability, I established testing best practices using Mocha, Chai, and Cypress, which aligns with your team’s high standards for code quality and production systems.

I have a history of building tools that streamline workflows. Early in my career, I developed a Firefox extension, SkipScreen, that automated user experiences on specific websites and grew to over 500,000 daily users. This project taught me how to identify user friction and build a simple, effective solution—a principle I see at the core of your developer-first tooling. While my most recent work has used Vue.js, I am familiar with React and confident in my ability to become productive quickly. I am also actively using AI tooling to improve my own engineering efficiency and am committed to continuous learning, as shown by my current coursework.

I am excited by the opportunity to contribute to a product that is critical to developers' daily work. I am eager to bring my experience in full-stack development, system architecture, and quality assurance to the LaunchDarkly team.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to discussing how I can help your team build the future of feature management.

Sincerely,
Michael Paulukonis

jobPosting.title: A new job awaits
jobPosting.content:
LaunchDarkly is seeking an experienced Full Stack Engineer to join our Feature Management team. This team’s mission is to empower developers with best-in-class controls and insights for managing software features. LaunchDarkly is best known for its Feature Management product, and in this role you’ll be at the forefront of impacting developers in this highly visible area. You’ll build features and tooling that are critically embedded throughout the software development lifecycle. You’ll enable developers improve their efficiency with seamless control of their software releases.

Responsibilities

Design and implement developer-first tooling such as MCP servers and browser toolbars. 
Deeply understand developer workflows so that you can streamline developer experiences. Directly influence the developer roadmap and experiential details by representing the voice of the developer. 
Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, UX designers, and engineers to create cohesive, end-to-end developer experiences. 
Participate actively in architecture planning, code reviews, and mentoring peers in full-stack best practices. 
As part of our you-build-it-you-run-it culture, all developers may be responsible of support applications in production, including on-call. 

Qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience building full stack web applications. Familiarity with Typescript, React, Node, and Go is preferred but not required. 
Strong sense of ownership and accountability for delivering impactful solutions. 
Proven ability to work closely with Product and Design teams to define requirements for new features in a fast-paced iterative environment. 
You write code that can be easily understood by others, with an eye towards maintainability. 
You hold yourself and others to a high bar when working with production systems. 
You value high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices. 
Strong collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills; committed to continuous learning about emerging technologies and mobile best practices. 
Experience utilizing AI tooling to enhance daily engineering efficiency.

coverLetter.content:
Michael Paulukonis
[michael.paulukonis@gmail.com](mailto:michael.paulukonis@gmail.com)
April 15, 2025

Hiring Manager
LaunchDarkly
San Francisco, CA

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Full Stack Engineer position on LaunchDarkly's Feature Management team. Your mission to empower developers with best-in-class controls aligns perfectly with my experience building developer-focused tools and my commitment to creating maintainable, high-quality software systems.

At Travelers, I led the development of several mission-critical developer tools and microservices using TypeScript, Node.js, and AWS technologies. I designed and implemented a flexible notification system that became a new team pattern for template-based communications, demonstrating my ability to create solutions that improve developer workflows. Working in a "you-build-it-you-run-it" environment, I established testing best practices that balanced development speed with code quality, using tools like Mocha, Chai, and Cypress.

While my primary frontend experience is with Vue.js rather than React, I have consistently shown the ability to adapt to new frameworks quickly. My experience with TypeScript and Node.js provides a strong foundation for working with LaunchDarkly's tech stack. I've recently enhanced my technical toolkit by completing coursework in Generative AI for Software Development, showing my commitment to staying current with emerging technologies that improve engineering efficiency.

I'm particularly drawn to LaunchDarkly's emphasis on developer experience and the opportunity to directly influence the developer roadmap. My background in transforming complex codebases into stable systems, combined with my experience collaborating across product and design teams, positions me well to contribute to your feature management platform. I would welcome the chance to discuss how my skills align with your team's needs.

Best regards,

Michael Paulukonis
coverLetter.sampleContent:
Michael Paulukonis
[michael.paulukonis@gmail.com](mailto:michael.paulukonis@gmail.com)
April 15, 2025

Hiring Manager
Vercel
New York, NY

**RE: Software Engineer, CI/CD**

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my strong interest in the Software Engineer, CI/CD position at Vercel. The opportunity to contribute to the core infrastructure that powers developer workflows at scale is particularly appealing, especially given Vercel's commitment to enabling developers to ship the best products. Your mission resonates deeply with my passion for improving the developer experience and my desire to have a tangible impact on how software is built and deployed on the web.

My background aligns well with many of the key requirements for this role. I have extensive experience building microservices, designing and maintaining APIs, and working with JavaScript/TypeScript in full-stack applications. My experience with AWS, including services like Lambda, API Gateway, and SQS, demonstrates my ability to build and deploy scalable systems. I'm also familiar with modern frontend frameworks like VueJS and React, which enables me to contribute to improving user interfaces. Furthermore, I've consistently focused on testing and documentation to ensure code quality and maintainability throughout my career. My previous experience with CI/CD tools has allowed me to become familiar with what developers need from such platforms.

While I don't have direct experience building a CI/CD platform, I have a strong understanding of CI/CD principles and workflows, and I'm eager to apply my skills to this specific domain. I recognize the importance of webhooks in the CI/CD process, and I'm confident in my ability to quickly learn and implement them effectively. Although I haven't specifically enhanced the reliability of CI/CD *platforms*, I have focused on enhancing the reliability of various types of systems and have experience with on-call rotations and problem solving in high-pressure situations. I am comfortable with adapting my skills to new technologies and domains and am confident I can become a valuable asset to your team.

I am enthusiastic about the possibility of joining Vercel and contributing to your mission of empowering developers. I am eager to learn more about the specific challenges and opportunities within your CI/CD team and how my skills and experience can contribute to your continued success. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,

Michael Paulukonis

Participate actively in architecture planning, code reviews, and mentoring peers in full-stack best practices. 
As part of our you-build-it-you-run-it culture, all developers may be responsible of support applications in production, including on-call. 

Qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience building full stack web applications. Familiarity with Typescript, React, Node, and Go is preferred but not required. 
Strong sense of ownership and accountability for delivering impactful solutions. 
Proven ability to work closely with Product and Design teams to define requirements for new features in a fast-paced iterative environment. 
You write code that can be easily understood by others, with an eye towards maintainability. 
You hold yourself and others to a high bar when working with production systems. 
You value high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices. 
Strong collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills; committed to continuous learning about emerging technologies and mobile best practices. 
Experience utilizing AI tooling to enhance daily engineering efficiency.

jobPosting.content:
https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/4259778448/?trackingId=HXRwLyJQ1py7lK1Z%2FdJi4g%3D%3D

LaunchDarkly
Full Stack Engineer, Feature Management

About the job


LaunchDarkly is seeking an experienced Full Stack Engineer to join our Feature Management team. This team’s mission is to empower developers with best-in-class controls and insights for managing software features. LaunchDarkly is best known for its Feature Management product, and in this role you’ll be at the forefront of impacting developers in this highly visible area. You’ll build features and tooling that are critically embedded throughout the software development lifecycle. You’ll enable developers improve their efficiency with seamless control of their software releases.

Responsibilities

Design and implement developer-first tooling such as MCP servers and browser toolbars. 
Deeply understand developer workflows so that you can streamline developer experiences. Directly influence the developer roadmap and experiential details by representing the voice of the developer. 
Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, UX designers, and engineers to create cohesive, end-to-end developer experiences. 
Participate actively in architecture planning, code reviews, and mentoring peers in full-stack best practices. 
As part of our you-build-it-you-run-it culture, all developers may be responsible of support applications in production, including on-call. 

Qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience building full stack web applications. Familiarity with Typescript, React, Node, and Go is preferred but not required. 
Strong sense of ownership and accountability for delivering impactful solutions. 
Proven ability to work closely with Product and Design teams to define requirements for new features in a fast-paced iterative environment. 
You write code that can be easily understood by others, with an eye towards maintainability. 
You hold yourself and others to a high bar when working with production systems. 
You value high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices. 
Strong collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills; committed to continuous learning about emerging technologies and mobile best practices. 
Experience utilizing AI tooling to enhance daily engineering efficiency. 

Pay

Target pay ranges based on Geographic Zones* for Level P3:

Zone 1: San Francisco/Bay Area or New York City Metropolitan Area (if not Bay area specific role): $167,000 - $210,000** 
Zone 2: Boston, DC, Irvine, LA, Monterey, Santa Barbara, Santa Rosa, Seattle: $150,200 - $190,000** 
Zone 3: All other US locations: $141,900 - $180,000** 

LaunchDarkly operates from a place of high trust and transparency; we are happy to state the pay range for our open roles to best align with your needs. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.

Within the United States, our geographic pay zones are defined by counties surrounding major metropolitan areas.
Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), health, vision, and dental insurance, and mental health benefits in addition to salary.

About LaunchDarkly

Modern software delivery was supposed to be the foundation for a thriving digital business but reality has proven otherwise. Slow, inefficient development cycles, costly outages, and fragmented customer experiences are preventing developers from building their best software. The LaunchDarkly platform helps developers innovate on new features faster while protecting them with a safety valve to instantly rewind when things go wrong. Developers can target product experiences to any customer segment and maximize the business impact of every feature. And by gradually rolling out new application components, they escape nightmare "big-bang" technology migrations.

The LaunchDarkly platform was built to guide engineers to the next frontier of DevOps by:

Improving the velocity and stability of software releases, without the fear of end customer outages
Delivering targeted experiences by easily personalizing features to customer cohorts
Maximizing the business impact of every feature through the ability to experiment and optimize
Coordinating the release and optimization of software to provide consistent experiences across mobile platforms and device types
Improving the effectiveness and productivity of engineering teams, by providing insights into engineering cadence and stability

coverLetter.content:
Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my strong interest in the Full Stack Engineer position on LaunchDarkly's Feature Management team. With extensive experience building full-stack web applications and microservices architectures, I am excited about contributing to LaunchDarkly's mission of empowering developers with best-in-class feature management tools.

At Travelers, I led a 5-person innovation team in developing a new insurance tech product using Node.js, TypeScript, and Vue.js, delivering from concept to market in under 6 months. This involved building microservices architecture with serverless components and implementing comprehensive testing practices using Mocha, Chai, and Cypress. My experience with AWS services and developer tooling, combined with recent work in AI-assisted development using tools like GitHub Copilot and Gemini CLI, aligns with LaunchDarkly's focus on developer productivity and high-quality code standards.

My work establishing testing best practices and mentoring peers demonstrates my commitment to code quality and maintainability. I've consistently balanced rapid development with robust testing, ensuring reliable production systems. While my primary experience has been with Vue.js rather than React, I bring strong TypeScript and Node.js expertise, along with a proven track record of quickly mastering new technologies. I'm currently expanding my AI tooling knowledge through coursework in Generative AI for Software Development, reflecting my dedication to emerging technologies.

What particularly draws me to LaunchDarkly is the opportunity to impact developers' daily workflows directly. Having experienced the challenges of feature management in enterprise environments, I understand the critical importance of reliable, efficient tooling. My experience collaborating with product managers and designers to define requirements, combined with my focus on developer experience, positions me well to contribute to LaunchDarkly's feature management platform.

I look forward to discussing how my technical expertise and collaborative approach could benefit LaunchDarkly's Feature Management team.

Best regards,
Michael Paulukonis
coverLetter.sampleContent:
Hiring Manager
TRV InsuraMatch
Hartford, CT

**RE: Software Engineer II Position**

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Software Engineer II position at InsuraMatch. With over 5 years of experience at Travelers, I have developed extensive expertise in insurance technology solutions using the exact technology stack specified in your requirements - JavaScript, Python, and SQL, along with AWS services and Twilio integration.

As a member of a 5-person innovation team at Travelers, I contributed to developing a new insurance tech product that launched in under 6 months using Node.js, TypeScript, and Vue.js. I helped build a cloud-native phone solution using Twilio and AWS Lambda, demonstrating the practical application of serverless architecture for customer interactions. My experience with microservices architecture includes working with AWS services like API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDB, while maintaining high code quality standards through comprehensive testing practices.

I'm particularly excited about InsuraMatch's focus on generative AI platforms. As a contributor to a patent for AI-driven analysis systems (US11,132,565B2) and through my current pursuit of Python for Data Science and Machine Learning coursework, I bring both established expertise and emerging skills in this rapidly evolving space. This ongoing learning demonstrates my commitment to growing technical capabilities, especially in areas crucial to InsuraMatch's future.

What attracts me most to this role is the opportunity to transform InsuraMatch's technology landscape while solving complex insurance technology challenges. I've successfully delivered multiple insurance-specific solutions and would welcome the chance to bring this experience to your team. My background in establishing testing best practices and providing technical guidance to team members aligns well with your needs for quality-focused development and mentorship.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to discussing how my skills and experience align with your needs.

Sincerely,
Michael Paulukonis
